page.title: 07GOVERNMENT Fire Brigade
page.content: The Fire Station is on the edge of the town next to the Police station and the Ambulance services. There are 7 men to each watch (4 to go on the engine, 2 to stay at the base and 1 extra) and the 4 watches work in pairs,12 hours at a time, to cover the day. There are no major fire hazards that could cause large explosions in Rickmansworth itself. Most bad fires to which they are called are in Watford, within the 7 mile radius which is their area.They are called to c.2-4 real fires a week; but there are many false alarms which they dare not ignore just in case.They are also called to accidents. It takes c. 30 seconds to get to the engine from the bell (they slide down the pole) and they have to be able to carry a 12 stone man 200 yards in a minute.They train on a false tower.
